result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymand Clifford Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.  Payment of $25 a month starting on or before 10/1/22 and on or before the first of every month till paid in full.

All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.  Payment of $25 a month starting on or before 10/1/22 and on or before the first of every month till paid in full.

The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.
Def is granted jail credit of 5 days.
Upon successful completion of conditions of this sentence, this case record will be expunged per Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Allowing Withdrawal of Counsel & To Pay Atty Fees & Csts
Order Allowing Withdrawal of Counsel and to Pay Attorney Fees and Costs
to Judge Mck fr Atty Ryder (re: JOC's CTS & EXP)

9:06 AM Defendant Raymand Clifford Lewis in court.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III in court for Raymand Clifford Lewis.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 20CM135, 22CM5, 20CM62, 20CM159, and 20CM118.  Parties have agreement.  State has complied with victim rights, no request for restitution.  Def understands charges and penalties.  Atty, def PLEADS NO CONTEST to the counts.  Files contain PLQ and DEJ, understands information, rights giving up, and elements.  Def is asking court to accept agreement.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied.  As a factual basis can court rely on information in the complaint.  Parties agree.  Court finds a factual basis exists, finds GUILTY and direct judgment to enter.  State comments on sentencing.  Atty comments on sentencing.  Court accepts DEJ and makes order of the court.  Offer can expunge the records def was under the age of 25.  If successfully completes, the record will be expunged in each case, def has no priors.  Atty was appointed by the court, payments to COC, def responsible to pay fees.  Financial obligation to be paid through the county at $25 a month starting on or before 10/1/22 and on or before the first of every month till paid in full.
ACJ Credit Calculation
